intro: Echites subcordatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Echites subcordatus is known for its resilience to drought conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
